title: WHO says aspartame is a 'possible carcinogen.' The FDA disagrees
description: Moderate consumption of aspartame is OK, scientists say. But heavy consumers may want to reduce their intake. The WHO says aspartame may "possibly" cause cancer.  The FDA questions the evidence.

title: Special counsel calls for a speedy trial in Trump's documents case
description: Lawyers for the special counsel team pushed back on a bid by former President Donald Trump for an indefinite delay in the  case, calling some of his arguments "baseless."

title: Last month was the hottest June ever recorded on Earth
description: June 2023 was the hottest June on record, going back to 1850. And forecasters expect more records to fall as El Niño exacerbates human-caused climate change.

title: Powerball jackpot climbs to $875 million, the third-largest on record
description: The new jackpot for the next drawing is the third-largest in the history of the game, coming behind the world record $2.04 billion jackpot won last year and the $1.586 billion jackpot won in 2016.

title: An LA deputy punched a woman in the face as she held her 3-week-old baby, video shows
description: Los Angeles County Sheriff Robert Luna released video of the July 2022 incident this week, saying he'd only just learned of it. He said the deputy has been disciplined and the FBI is looking into it.

title: Hollywood actors go on strike, say it's time for studio execs to 'wake up'
description: SAG-AFTRA, the union representing Hollywood actors and performers, is on strike against major studios after negotiations broke down with the Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers.

title: A record-breaking Burmese python — as long as a giraffe is tall — caught in Florida
description: The snake, stretching 19 feet, was caught in the Big Cypress National Preserve. The invasive species runs rampant through southern Florida, wreaking havoc on the state's native animal populations.

title: FTC investigating ChatGPT over potential consumer harm
description: ChatGPT sees its first hint of regulation as the federal agency requests documentation about its business practices.

title: The southwest's enduring heat wave is expected to intensify over the weekend
description: More than 111 million people across the U.S. remain under weather advisories or warnings as forecasters say an oppressive heat wave might get worse before it gets any better.

title: The federal deficit nearly tripled, raising concern about the country's finances
description: The federal government's budget gap widened significantly in the first nine months of the fiscal year, as tax receipts slumped and spending increased.

title: Feds to investigate Georgia's Fulton County Jail for filthy, dangerous conditions
description: The investigation into the Atlanta-based jail comes almost a year after the death of Lashawn Thompson who died in a bedbug-infested cell in Fulton County Jail's psychiatric wing.

title: Nigerians are rattled by prices that just keep going up. How are they coping?
description: When the government ended its fuel subsidy in May, the cost of gas, food and public transport all jumped. On buses, customers double up in seats — "lapping' they call it — to split a fare.

title: America doesn't really care about cricket. Can Major League Cricket change that?
description: The new league makes its debut near Dallas on Thursday when the Texas Super Kings play the LA Knight Riders. The league's backers hope to cultivate a new generation of U.S. cricketers.

title: 'The Beast You Are' is smart, self-aware, fun, creepy, and strange
description: These Paul Tremblay stories — a wildly entertaining mix of literary horror, psychological suspense and science fiction — will be more than enough to make readers into immediate fans.

title: Why the crack cocaine epidemic hit Black communities 'first and worst'
description: "We won't heal until we make sense of the crack epidemic," Donovan X. Ramsey says. His book, When Crack Was King, examines the drug's destructive path through the Black community.

title: FDA approves Opill, the first daily birth control pill without a prescription
description: From convenience stores to online, the tablet "will be an available option for millions of people in the United States," the director of the FDA's Center for Drug Evaluation and Research says.

title: A top Guatemalan party is barred, throwing the presidential election into the unknown
description: Guatemala's already troubled presidential election has been thrown into more chaos and confusion only weeks ahead of a contentious second round of voting.

title: Up First briefing: Defense bill delayed; Threads' news policy; SAG-AFTRA strike vote
description: GOP House lawmakers want to amend the defense authorization bill. Twitter rival Threads wants to downgrade news and politics. The Hollywood actors union holds a strike vote this morning.

title: Key takeaways from this week's NATO summit, according to the group's leader
description: NATO's expansion is the exact opposite of what Russia wanted, says Secretary-General Jens Stoltenberg. He spoke to NPR about its NATO's newest members, and when Ukraine might join them.

title: RFK Jr. is building a presidential campaign around conspiracy theories
description: The latest member of the Kennedy dynasty to run for president regularly shares a dizzying range of falsehoods and conspiracy theories on podcasts and at other campaign appearances.

title: An otter in Santa Cruz is hassling surfers — and stealing their boards
description: The 5-year-old female southern sea otter was first seen hijacking surfboards in Santa Cruz last September. Officials successfully drove the otter away from the area, but she has since returned.

title: Biden frames his clean energy plan as a jobs plan, obscuring his record on climate
description: President Biden's Inflation Reduction Act invests $369 billion to address the climate crisis. But as the president focuses on the law's economic benefits, is his climate win getting lost?

title: How the Supreme Court's conservative majority came to be
description: The 6-3 majority was solidified in former President Donald Trump's term, but its roots go back to the Bushes and the political circumstances of 1991 and 2005.

title: Tornado touches down near Chicago's O'Hare airport, disrupting hundreds of flights
description: A tornado touched down Wednesday evening near Chicago's O'Hare International Airport, prompting passengers to take shelter and disrupting hundreds of flights. There were no reports of injuries.
